newsitem.title: PAKISTAN: Pakistan money rates fall on lending pressure.
newsitem.headline: Pakistan money rates fall on lending pressure.

text.p: Pakistan's money market rates fell on Wednesday amid lending pressure, dealers said.
The overnight market closed at 15 percent on lending pressure and no discounting was reported, a dealer at the Standard Chartered Bank in Karachi said.
The State (central) Bank of Pakistan accepted about one billion rupees in its regular weekly open market operation at an annualised cut-off yield of 17.40 percent, the said.
The rates' movement on Thursday will depend on the result of a special open market operation set by the central bank for the day, the dealer said. -- Ibrahim Khan 9221-5685192
